CONSULTANT

SUMMARY

Position in Accounting/Regulatory or banking operations
Highlights
Microsoft Office, Lotus Notes, QuickBooks, ACBS, BCS, OTG, AP, RECON+, FMS (G/L System), REVAL (evaluation of hedged funding) and Bloomberg.

Certificate of Recognition for the year 1998 that helped in lifting of the
agreement with Federal Reserve Bank of New York. I was also awarded Certificate
of Appreciation for the year 1999.

Preparation of accounts, reports and financial statements for their clients.
Provide all accounting services to their customers.
Senior Accountant/Accounting Officer

Company Name

State
The New York Branch of Bank Hapoalim represents the banking andÂ  Reviewed Bank's General Ledger and pass necessary entries to correct the G/L.
The main purpose to review the G/L to make ensure bank's books is accurate and reconciled with sub-system.

Post Journal entries to general ledger system.

Assist in special project as directed by the Controller and CFO.
Supervise the bank reconciliation and accounts payable process.
Supervise and ensure accuracy in the prepaid and Fixed Assets records and comply with the Fixed Assets policy.
Balance Sheet reconciliation and Custody reconciliation.
Ensure general ledger booking is in the line with bank accounting policy and principles (GAAP) standards and abides by with regulatory laws.
Obtain securities prices and prepare monthly FAS115 valuation worksheets and accounting entries.
Performed accounting and prepare monthly reports for two of the Bank's subsidiaries using QuickBooks.
Responsible for preparation of Amortization of Premium and Discount reconciliation for Callable CDs Prepared aging analysis of suspense items report and various financial reports for senior management.
Responsible for Assets Swaps accounting, Government bonds/securities, securities available for sale, trading and Non-Trading securities.
Prepared written accounting policies and procedures.
Responsible for maintenance of Chart of Accounts /adding and modifying.
And open new G/L account.
Processed payments/expenditure for vendors, employee expenses, contractors, state and federal government taxes payments.

State

FR 2900, FR2951, BL 1, BC, BQ, BL (SA), BC (SA), and FFIEC 002 (Call Report by using DPSC Software, Inc.
Package).

Also responsible for statistical reports, and quarterly reports to Department of Commerce.
Prepared and responsible for month end closing.
Prepared and developed the Compliance procedure and Compliance Manual, detail task checklist use to comply the BSA, FRB Regulations, and US Sanctions in order to satisfy the compliance requirements of the Branch.
Evaluation of existing accounting procedures and implemented changes in order to simplify the accounting procedures.
Prepared and presented monthly variance analysis reports to Senior Management.
Prepared monthly, quarterly written report regarding the BSA, OFAC, US Sanctions and FRB regulation compliance.
Preparation of sales tax and commercial rent tax.
Handling NYS Banking and FRB examiners.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Head of Sales

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Information Technology, Sales

Description:
ThoughtFocus is seeking an experienced and dynamic Head of Sales to lead our sales department and contribute individually to our technology consulting services sales. This role is a unique blend of strategic leadership and hands-on sales execution, ideal for a results-driven professional passionate about driving growth in the tech consulting sector. Reporting directly to the CEO, the Head of Sales will play a pivotal role in shaping our sales strategy, developing our sales team, and personally engaging in high-level sales initiatives to achieve and exceed our sales targets.
Key Responsibilities: - Develop and implement a comprehensive sales strategy that aligns with the company's growth objectives. - Lead, mentor, and scale the sales team to achieve sales targets through effective training, coaching, and performance management. - Work closely with the marketing department to ensure a cohesive approach to market penetration and brand positioning. - Actively engage in individual sales efforts, particularly in securing high-value clients and strategic partnerships. - Utilize deep industry knowledge and personal network to identify and pursue new business opportunities within the technology consulting sector. - Manage key customer relationships, ensuring high levels of satisfaction and loyalty, and identifying opportunities for upselling and cross-selling. - Collaborate with the product and service development teams to ensure offerings meet market needs and expectations. - Provide regular reports to the CEO and board on sales performance, market trends, and competitive analysis. - Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and networking events to enhance business development efforts.
Requirements:- Minimum of 10 years of sales experience, with a significant portion in technology consulting or a related field.- Proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets, both as an individual contributor and team leader.- Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate a sales team.- Exceptional communication and negotiation skills, with the aptitude to engage effectively with C-level executives.- Bachelor's degree in business administration, Marketing, or a related field. A Master's degree is a plus.
Salary and Benefits:- Base Salary: $200,000 - $250,000, commensurate with experience.- Attractive commission structure based on individual and team sales performance.- Company-based bonuses.- Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision insurance, retirement plans, and generous vacation policy.
This position offers a remarkable opportunity to lead and contribute to the sales efforts of a forward-thinking technology consulting firm. If you are a seasoned sales professional with a passion for technology and a track record of success, we encourage you to apply.

Experience Level (if available): Executive
<JD_END>
